reviews.review_title: Doesnt deserve the beat down it got
reviews.content: Let me start by saying i am in no means saying this was a great movie, what i AM saying is that it is not the trainwreck people are making it out to be. It has its moments. The Bennifer hype definitely had alot to do with it bombing at the box office. Its not a terrible story. Its definitely in my dvd collection. I didnt love it but i definitely didnt hate it.

From Razzie winning director Martin Brest (Beverly Hills Cop, Midnight Run, Scent of a Woman, Meet Joe Black), I had heard that this was meant to be one of the worst films ever, so I challenged myself to watch and see what I would think. Basically in Los Angeles, Larry Gigli (Razzie winning and nominated Ben Affleck) is a low ranking mobster who acts tough but is nowhere the exterior he portrays, and his latest job is to kidnap the younger brother of a powerful federal prosecutor, mentally challenged Brian (The Hangover's Justin Bartha), to save New York mob boss Starkman (Razzie nominated Al Pacino) from going to prison. Gigli convinces Brian to go with him, to take him "to the Baywatch", this seems to be the young man's singular obsession, Louis (Lenny Venito) who ordered the kidnapping does not trust Gigli to get the job done right, so taking charge of the situation and keeping an eye on him is a woman calling herself Ricki (Razzie winning and nominated Jennifer Lopez). Gigli is becoming frustrated that Louis has no faith in him and is forcing him to take orders from a woman, that Brian keeps insisting on going "to the Baywatch" and calling the phone number for weather reports, and that he is attracted to Ricki but she is a lesbian, she even explains why she loves the vagina and female anatomy more than the male. During the time they spend together the kidnappers are hankered with a visit from Detective Stanley Jacobellis (Razzie nominated Christopher Walken), and they are at one point forced to pay a visit to Gigli's overbearing Mother (Razzie nominated Lainie Kazan), and Brian, although keeping quiet most of the time, sings rap songs and talks about his longing to be with a beautiful woman. Then Gigli and Ricki receive orders that turn events dark, they must cut off Brian's thumb and send it to Louis, neither of them want to do this, and worse comes when Ricki's girlfriend Robin (Missy Crider) shows up accusing her of cheating, she also slits her wrists and must be taken to hospital, while there Gigli cuts off a thumb from a corpse in the morgue. Following this back at the apartment Gigli confesses his love for Ricki, and she confesses to having been developing some feelings for him, and finally the pair sleep together, but the following day they are called together by Louis to meet Starkman. The mob boss reveals that he did not actually want the mentally challenged young man to be kidnapped, and the thumb that was cut off did not match his fingerprints, he kills Louis in front of them, he is about to kill Gigli, but Ricki, who is a very good talker, persuades him to think twice, eventually he puts the gun down and allows them to leave. The pair decide it is time to take Brian back to where he belongs, on the journey however he spots a filmmaking crew shooting on the beach, similar to Baywatch, it turns out this is what he wanted, to go to a beach with beautiful women on it, they leave Brian happy there, Ricki initially leaves, but she drives back to pick up Gigli, and they leave town together. Affleck is not all that cool and charismatic, Lopez is gorgeous but with not a lot of substance, they may have been a couple in real life, but their on screen connection is only mildly believable, as for Walken and Pacino, they don't have all that much to do apart from give their predictable personas. I hardly laughed at all, I was appalled by the foul mouthed abuse aimed at the innocent disabled character, also unbelievably the butt of jokes, I was cringing with most of the ridiculous dialogue, especially Lopez opening her legs and saying "It's turkey time. Gobble, gobble.", the love story is silly, and the crime element is underused, I agree this is worth seeing just to see how bad it is, a terrible romantic crime comedy. It won the Razzies for Worst Picture, Worst Screen Couple and Worst Screenplay for Martin Brest, Worst 'Comedy' of Our First 25 Years, and it was nominated for Worst Picture of the Decade. Pretty poor!

reviews.review_title: So ridiculous you have to see it to believe it.
reviews.content: A gangster themed romantic comedy sounds pretty ridiculous, but I guess it could work. A gangster themed romantic comedy with Ben Affleck playing a thug with a heart of gold is too ridiculous to exist, yet here I am having just sat through close to two hours of it. Wow, why would anyone make such a thing? Ben Affleck is clearly wrong for the part of the italiano style thug, he's neither italiano nor a thug, and he's the main character. But it gets better, director Martin Brest decided to write in J-LO as a lesbian who can be converted to heterosexuality by said non-thug in a matter of days. Now, she is supposed to be some kind of hard, stone cold femme fatale but she fails at being anything like that. I would much rather have watched Melissa Lahlitah Crider, who shows up briefly as J-Lo's girlfriend, in the role. The film does have a saving grace though, in the form of Al Pacino's cameo. That being said, Gigli is not really a bad film, extremely ridiculous but not bad; more sort of mediocre, well at the low end of mediocre but still, one notch above bad.

O.K. First off let me say that I did not think this movie was the best one I've seen this year or even in the top 50 for that matter. However 6th worst??? Legally Blonde 2 was better?? How can that be? Now I'm not a big J-Lo fan (except those legs), but Ben's a competent actor and the film has some merit. I think the real problem is that it is popular to rag on the two of them these days. And they have been taking a flogging IMO. As much as they deny it, critics are all about the popular vote. Truly if a critic doesn't have the same opinion of a presentation as the masses then over a period of time you discredit them as a hack...So it is in their best intrest to agree with the popular vote. Too bad it fell on this film...Not a great film mind you....but I made it all the way thru and that doesn't happen for me all the time. 5/10 atleast

I just saw this movie, and I think it's good. There's no way this is the worst movie ever made, and I don't think it should belong to the bottom 100 films. Ben and J-Lo were great. Ben is cool, and J-Lo is hot, and the movie isn't bad. I give it 8/10.

I got the DVD of this terrible film to see if it was in fact the worst film ever made. That honour still belongs to "Swept Away", because Madonna is so much less of an actress, and that film is even more of a self indulgent mess. However Gigli is a worthy runner up. What hold does director Martin Brest have over Al Pacino that persuaded him, after the ghastly "Scent of a Woman" to do an imitation Ben Kingsley (as in Sexy Beast) in this floperoo? And why was anyone persuaded that the script, by Brest, was worth making in the first place? Devoid of wit, characterisation, plot, or anything to look at, the film is a succession of telephone calls, entrances and exits, and shots of people thinking. the editor could have lost 40 minutes of the final running time, and only made the film ten times better.Better yet would if it had never been made at all.

reviews.review_title: Probably The Most Underrated Movie Ever... Seriously...
reviews.content: I (unlike 50% of the 2,000 people who gave this movie a 1) sawthis movie, and let me just say that this was the best movie of theyear (yes, better than PoTC). I can't believe why people gave it a 1(possibly because they are sick of J Lo and Ben?). First off, themovie was advertised horribly wrong, and because of that, themovie suffered at the box office. I'm dissapointed beyond belief atthis point. Why don't you people see the movie before you judge it?I used to love IMDB, but now I just can't stand it. See Gigli, it is atruly terrific film. The acting is amazing (even J. Lo is excellent). The story is great,and the supporting cast is phenomenal. Go see it!!!!!!!! It truly isone of the best of the year if not ever. I admit that when I saw thepreview, I thought it looked horrible, but after I actually watched thefilm I was stunned at how amazingly good it was. 10/10 seriously.

reviews.review_title: Not sure why it is so bad for others and not for me??!!
reviews.content: Movie lacks a plot, yes. Movie lacks main stream theme, yes., but does it lack anything else, No. Are there mistakes, yes but there are several movies which are rated 6-7 and lack almost similar things with added disadvantage that they have bad dialogs and acting. Acting in the movie is very good and is almost at best level. Making of movie is of top level. I can only say someone somewhere lost some interest. It has some very profound dialogs which only less than one percent of the population can understand. May be that is the reason that people could not like it. It leaves you dangling at the end but why cannot we read love all over flowing in the eyes than being told with explicit scenes. Jennifer is not convincing as lesbian, she is too hot, I admin if this portrayal wrecked the movie unconsciously, may be. If you watch this movie with full disdain for plot then there is nothing wrong with the movie. Just watch with a moving window of ten minutes story and you will feel the power of absurdity with which people have thrown this gem away. I am going to watch this movie couple of times to really understand what is bad.

I know is not good to keep burning a movie when the fury against it finished, but I just watched yesterday, and I have the urge of talk about this project of junk bad built.Is like those science projects that children have to do by themselves, without the help of parents or any models or sketches. What I want to say is that this movie is even worst than my English level, is totally retarded, there is really no plot, only a lot of dialogs related to sex and more sex. Sex is cool, but with this movie is more a kids play than a real adult conversation.Jennifer Lopez is impossible to believe as a lesbian. If she is a lesbian, she would never have sex with Ben. And Ben is impossible to believe as a macho guy, he is more girlie than Jennifer.But the horror is not finished yet, because then Christopher Walken (yeah, the guy from Deer hunter) and Al Pacino (somebody remember him from The godfather? No?) appear to finally ruin their careers with two scenes very un-needed. Like the whole movie.Billy Crystal was right in his 2003 Oscar video. Gigli the director's cut will be 120 shorter than the original movie.

With how strong the vitriol for this film is, I am going to come across as an apologist for it. I did not like this movie. Giving it 5/10 does not mean I liked it, it means the good and the bad canceled each other out.There are many reasons to like this movie. There is some witty dialog, despite what the overwhelming majority say, and Ben Affleck minus some of his horrid flirting scenes is completely serviceable in this film. I think it was lost on some people that this is a comedy, and much of the comedy in this movie is derived from watching Ben Affleck's character be put in awkward and strange situations. The most obvious example of this is the morgue scene where he needs to get a finger, and only has a cheap plastic knife at his disposal, while also having to babysit a mentally ill hostage. Christopher Walken has a great wacky Walken scene in this movie that if you took in any way other than comedy, you did it wrong. I almost recommend the movie for the scene with Al Pacino alone. He may be playing a caricature of previous roles he has done, but he does it oh so well.Now, the bad. Yes, quite a bit of the dialog is drawn out and sub par, especially between Affleck and Lopez. There are several lines in the movie that I would say are worthy of being enshrined in the terrible dialog hall of shame. I would say that the mental illness humor probably wasn't as big of a hit as the script hopes for, because there is a lot of it. I would say that if the viewer cannot stand Ben Affleck, or does not like situational humor that Gigli finds himself in, this movie can turn into an unfunny comedy. And trust me, I understand that not much is worse than an unfunny comedy. Thankfully the humor in this movie worked enough for me that I got through the movie without hating it, and if it was 10 or 15 minutes shorter, I probably would have given it a 6. I wouldn't recommend the movie as a whole, but I would definitely recommend the Al Pacino scene by itself. If this is the worst movie you have ever seen, you haven't seen enough movies.

reviews.review_title: Well, why am I really surprised about this??
reviews.content: Hmmmm....., it Boggles the mind as to how Martin Brest did'nt smell this screenplay arriving at his door.  It was ripe for problems.  When Halle Berry jumps ship on it, thats generally a sign it's in trouble. Certainly, the obnoxious Quotient of Bennifer and J-Fleck did'nt help but, I truly prayed for this to work out for the best, if just for the sake of Martin Brest (Christ man He made Midnight Run!!).  As for Pacino and Walken, well Pacino lost it a long time ago, (the HooHa!! thing from Scent of a Woman went to his head, so all he does is mug and yell now) But Walken must have Just needed spending Cash.  Although it still ain't worse than Swept Away, Gigli is pretty damn bad!!!

this has got to be one of the worst major releases in years. the movie is about a gangster{ben affleck} who teams up with a lesbian gangster{jennifer lopez} to guard a mentally challenged kid while they wait for orders from their boss;that's practically the whole story.the film is very boring and sometimes just plain dumb. the dialogue is bad as is the acting.the worst thing about this movie is the story , it makes no sense and it is simply horrible.there are 2 scenes in the movie which were a little bit enjoyable;- 1.a scene were ben affleck tries to seduce lopez and she says you're not my type, he says "what about me is not you're type?" she says, your p*nis. 2.a scene where they're in the post office and lopez starts flirting with another woman, much to the dismay of affleck.apart from that this is a very bad movie and you should not watch it.

I remember the day in 2003 after this movie came out. My father and I were watching television early on a Saturday morning, and some sort of all-purpose newscast brought up "Gigli," which had apparently imploded following one night of screening. When the film finally turned up on videocassette at a thrift store for fifty cents five years later, I decided I would take the plunge.I had a hard time telling what was funny because it was funny, and what was supposed to be dramatic and turned out funny because it was bad, and what was supposed to be funny but turned out bad because it was bad. The plot - following two "contractors" and the mentally retarded man they kidnap - takes place primarily indoors, with a healthy mix of driving scenes that seem to inexplicably seem to loop back to the same house each time. Christopher Walken and Al Pachino both appear for one scene each, then vanish - giving the film an Alice-in-Wonderland feel, as if the whole thing was written by somebody running a fever of 102.Maybe it was.What I will say for "Gigli" was that it is watchable. It's not something I'd pay more than fifty cents to see, but was watchable. This sets it apart from a lot of the other bad movies I've seen - or, for that matter, some of the allegedly good ones. The worst movie I ever saw was called "Breaking the Waves." Yes, I know the rest of you liked it, but I didn't. Sometimes quality and watchability are at odds - and here, a bad movie was watchable. Despite the incredibly bad... everything, I never actually felt compelled to turn the TV off.In my opinion, this was a bad movie. A really, REALLY bad movie. But it never really crossed the line from "awful" to "unbearable." So yeah, watch it if you get the chance. But don't tell anybody you did.

This is by far the worst movie EVER!! Critics call it "Imagine a movie made out of deleted scenes!"Thats the only one I know. The story? Well who cares?! The movie is so bad, you'll hardly notice it. The dialogue is atrocoius, and the actors acting is terrible. It even won 9 razzies! JLo's performance proves that singers shouldn't act. Just look at Britney Spears in Crossroads, and Beyonce Knowes in Austin Powers 3. Ben Affleck is an okay actor, but this is not forgivable. Not even Al Paccino or Christopher Walken can save this movie from going down the drain!  Gigli gets a very generous 1 out of 5.

If watching Benifer (one of the greatest actors of all time) is not enough this gem throws in a retard. Imagine putting the greatest movies of all time into a pot mixing them with great acting and what do you get? Yup GIGLI. "Gone with the Wind" +"Godfather"+"American Pie"='Gigli'. The love story of Benifer had me sobbing while the dirty jokes cleverly disguised by the idiosyncrasies of a retard had me laughing for days! Al Pacino's scene was reminiscent of his earlier works like the "Godfather" and "Heat", simply brilliant. Yes the movie may have had one or two tiny plot holes and the story may have been a bit underdeveloped but the movie easily made up for it through its comedy, drama and light love story. See this movie and be prepared to be taken on a movie journey of a lifetime.

I swear, people are sheep. They are 100%, died in the wool, that wool pulled over their eyes sheep. Honestly, I don't think anyone really looks at how easy it is to sway public opinion. Look at how many people STILL believe that our attack on Iraq was part of the War Against Terror when everyone, even administration who wanted the war!, said that Iraq was not a terrorist state and that there was nothing between Hussein and militant fundamentalist Islamic cells other than hostility. But point people to something and tell them it's "Baddddd" and they'll move right along, "Baddddd!" (<--- Imagine sheep noise for full effect.) "Yay! Something we get to pick on! Yay! Something we get to throw stones at!" Case in point ... _Gigli_. I watched it recently, waiting for it to suck. "It's supposed to suck," I said. "When't it going to start sucking?" Now, I'm not saying it's _Citizen Kane_ or anything, but it's far, far from being the laughable Crap Fest that everyone says it was. It seemed like a decent Romantic ... I don't quite know what genre to put it in. It's not a Romantic Comedy because it's not trying to be funny. It's kind of a softer _Out of Sight_ or a _Get Shorty_ with a more even pace that's not trying to be a hip satire. Maybe it's just me. Maybe I have no taste. But more likely people wanted to jump on the "Dump on the Hollywood Couple That Everyone Loved to Hate" Bandwagon.Look, _Gigli's_ not fabulous, but it's not bad. Get over yourselves. Oh, and to the guy who thought the yoga scene was overlong ... you may be right. So to save you more torture, the next time Jennifer Lopez chooses to do contortions in skin tight workout clothes while languidly discussing the wonders of the vagina, give me your ticket. Straight up, I will sit in for you. No, no. Don't thank me. It's the least I can do.

Here is a question I keep asking myself: How could the director of one of my all-time favorite movies(Scent of a woman), Martin Brest, could come up with a fiasco like this? I watched this film to see exactly what was so horrible about it.Basically, the plot is useless, the acting is awful and is an unfortunate failure in many ways. The worst of them all, I think, are the painfully long dialogs that Ben Affleck and Jennifer Lopez deliver in a lot of scenes. Lopez is completely unconvincing as a lesbian gangster and Affleck tries, but unfortunately cannot convince anybody why he is what he is. It's certainly true what they say about the scene where Ricki's "ex lover" slits her wrists, useless as a car with no gas. I kept watching however, because Al Pacino's scene was coming up. His character shoots Gigli's boss dead, which makes him somewhat of a threat and a little scary. But unfortunately, as somehow predicted, what followed was disappointing: Lopez somehow manages to fix the situation in her mobster manner, which I repeat, is sadly not convincing, a fact which saves her and Gigli's lives. Would it have been better if Starkman(Pacino) killed them both? I don't know.All I know is this: I didn't watch the ending because it seemed so useless and I don't need to watch it again. We get to see Christopher Walken and Al Pacino in a "movie", that was the only highlight. It ruined everybody that worked on the movie's career and I felt sorry for them. Fortunately for the actors, Pacino especially, they were able to get more interesting works done after that. But alas, for Martin Brest, it put a stop to his career, hopefully not permanently.

reviews.review_title: Really not as bad as they say
reviews.content: I really wonder if somebody tipped off the press to just hate this movie, because Star Trek: Nemesis or A Guy Thing where (by far) a lot worst. If this movie had been with a low profile couple, I'm sure it would have had good press.Anyway, don't listen to what the critic says, it just proves when it comes to analysing, they're definitely NOT objective. Gigli was not exceptional but it had it's good moments and was pretty cool and fun, over all.

reviews.review_title: It's not that bad, not that good, just average.
reviews.content: I avoided this movie in the theatres, even though I genuinely like Ben Affleck movies in general, simply because of all the negative hype that surrounded it. After watching it on DVD, I have to wonder if critics and others just teed off on this film because of who the stars were. If you took the same plot with two different actors, I don't think you would have seen such an outcry of hate.The biggest problem is that Gigli is supposed to be a Bad Ass Tough Guy hitman, but we never see that from him. Even in the opening scene he is jokingly collecting from the laundromat guy. This makes it hard to buy into the fact that being around Brian has somehow caused a change in him. The same goes for Ricki/Rochelle. She is brought in we are told to be just as bad as Gigli, but again we never see it. It becomes more of a Chasing Amy plot with Brian playing the Banky role and the Bennifer duo playing hitmen instead of artists.Ben and Jennifer play their parts well, but Justin Bartha outshines them both in the role of Brian. The story has holes, but it also has a great guest appearance from Christopher Walken. Overall and average film that probably only got made because the leads are on the covers of the grocery aisle rags every week.Worth a rental, but I wouldn't buy it.....

I thought it was about time I watched this movie, just to see how bad it really is, in case it was so bad it was funny. I can see why it had a bad reputation: silly dialog, tons of plot holes, goofy performances, and plenty of overdone sentiment augmented by a drippy soundtrack.That shouldn't be enough to give a movie the kind of reputation this one had, though. I think it had more to do with a backlash against Ben and Jen. As a story, it's definitely screwy, but most of its problems aren't anything you wouldn't find in numerous big budget hits.Basically, Ben Affleck's character kidnaps a mentally impaired man as part of an extortion job. Jennifer Lopez is another hit man assigned to the same job, forcing them to work together. They fall in love over the course of the job, and learn lessons of life and love from each other and the kidnappee.I found it entertaining enough to watch all the way through without fast forwarding, until the last few moments. Both leads had moments that they did well. Even though it's kind of silly to think of Ben Affleck as a tough guy killer, I liked the scenes where he would get angry and swear. Jennifer Lopez had some really cringe-worthy lines in which she had to give silly monologues. She would talk for a few minutes and use a lot of big words, and it was supposed to change the mind of whoever was listening to her. I guess her character was supposed to be persuasive. She did do a good job being seductive, but her role was supposed to be a contract killer. Nothing her character did established her as dangerous, except that we were told so.Put on top of that the orchestral swells that are instructing us to get misty-eyed when nothing emotional is happening, and you have a movie that just about exists in an alternate universe. The script never should have been approved, and the director should never have been assigned to this project. It was a real mismatch. But I'm still not sure I would have hated as much as the folks who bad mouthed it over the years.

Gigli has a reputation. It's the kind of movie that, without seeing it or really knowing anything about it, you expect not good things. For a considerable amount of time it put a black spot on two seriously talented people and was considered one of the worst movies of it's time.Finally watching it for myself though and I don't really get why. Yeah, this isn't a good movie. It's clunky and awkward, it's forced and ridiculous but it is in no way as awful as it's made out to be. This is a forgettable nonsense movie that would be perfectly at home replaying on daytime tv for the hundredth time. Honestly, I wouldn't even hate it if it happened to be on somewhere and that's really the big issue. People act like this is some vile, reprehensible film and I just don't think it's worth that level of disdain. It's just an underwhelming film. Nothing more. Nothing less.

reviews.review_title: Is this a money wasting exercise?
reviews.content: This was a very cheaply made movie that i just cannot work out where the 54 million was spent? It certainly was not the plot... Was it the actors bill?Tax Right off?Cause we saw no explosions Smashed cars Special effects except when one of the 4 main characters dies the rest was well all in all flat.We had two cameos in that Walken does a walk in .... reads a few lines then walks out.Then Pacino reads some lines and does what he has done in dozens of movies and that's it.They finish the movie with well something I could have written in like five minutes.If it had a plot .... perhaps build up others outside Affleck and Lopez it could be better. No one was likable except Justin Bartha who must have thought this was his big break and did a excellent job.PS: Shelby Fenner please don't try that Aussie accent again!!!

reviews.review_title: It's Really As Bad As They Say
reviews.content: How does a movie like this ever get released? Aren't there studio executives who actually screen the film before they allow it to be shown to the public? And isn't it their job to say "Hmmmmmm, this is one really bad movie. Maybe we should shelve it rather than try to cheat our customers out of a $9.00 admission." Taking money from people to allow them to see GIGLI borders on consumer fraud.There were about twenty people in the theater when the movie began. Fewer than five were still there by the time this moronic piece of trash mercifully ended. One of the patrons "broke wind" rather loudly midway through the screening -- that event was the highlight of the movie-going experience and a welcome break from the on-screen action.I would comment on the plot, dialog, acting, etc, but that would be a waste of bandwidth. Simply put, this movie smells worse than my underwear.

reviews.review_title: Not As bad as everyone says
reviews.content: Ben and Jennifer's chemistry is undeniable. Some funny moments.

reviews.review_title: nowhere near as bad as people claim
reviews.content: this film is nowhere as bad as people claim, alright it is not fantastic and it's plot is a little dodgy. lesbian falls for Ben affleck, OK this seems to be a career pattern (implausable leading ladies!!!) but there are a hell of a lot worse movies. just put your brain into neutral and enjoy!!! this film is not Shakespeare and it does not pretend to be. it is a dodgy crime flick and non the worse for it. martin Brest (the director ) has a fantastic film inside him waiting to escape, let's not hold this against him, and one day he will dazzle us. Ben affleck for all his faults is a decent leading man (daredevil, Armageddon, bounce, chasing Amy) he just needs some decent scripts (i don't think he is capable of saving a bad script) maybe he should write them himself!! don't believe the negative press, give this a try

reviews.review_title: Overlong, dull in places, but NOT the worst movie I've ever seen.
reviews.content: It is bad, but I've seen plenty worse. There seem to be a lot of people here that seem to have given this a one because they think that was what they were supposed to do considering all the negative publicity that surrounded it.It isn't brilliant, but it doesn't deserve that kind of treatment.As far as how the movie actually plays...Its too long. The dialogue drags on insanely long in some scenes and the actual things said are some of the most contrived and forced I've ever heard. Christopher Walken's cameo is tedious and annoying.In short, what should be a funny "finding each other" movie becomes mired in a messy, poorly scripted gangster movie.Performances from the cast are reasonable and a far cry from the horror some would have you believe.In short, it's not as bad as you might think.SUMMARY: Too long, terrible dialogue that drags on. Lacks direction and focus. Not as bad as it has been made out to be, but not that good either.

reviews.review_title: A Disappointment from the start to one of the worst of 2003
reviews.content: From the other comment that was made on this film by the way is definely true. For one,this movie was pure trash from the start since I saw this film during a sneak preview and someone needs to tell actor Ben Affleck to find better acting gigs instead of this piece of unadultered dung. This is the second film that Affleck has done that has basically flop at the box office,a prime example was the action flick "Daredevil". I asked why is Al Pacino and Christopher Walken totally wasted in their supporting roles here? They should have known better. Basically,it is not their fault. I personally blame the director of this flick,Martin Brest for this piece of disasterous mess. Secondly,a word of advice to actor Ben Affleck......anyone who teams up with the worst actress in Hollywood(Jennifer Lopez)should know upfront that she is totally box-office poison. One of the worst films of 2003 and it totally shows.NOTE: Any actor who teams up with either Jennifer Lopez,Sandra Bullock, Cameron Diaz,and Nicole Kidman should stay away from the four WORST actresses in film today.

reviews.review_title: Surprised that it wasn't as critiqued !
reviews.content: I watched this movie after reading and hearing the negatives blasted at the public by various media, and I concluded that it was okay, and a movie that I would watch again somewhere down the road. No critical comments; simply an entertaining movie, and I will shut movies down in the middle or earlier rather than waste my time simply to see the ending. You Got Served and Rollerball(2002) are PRIME examples of time wasted. I've seen movies that have proved to be much less entertaining, and I've seen actors with seemingly no interest in each other, trying to emote passion. I have also sat thru dialogue that seemed to have been written by middle-school wannabee novelists ! No Oscars here, but not worth the trashing it took either. 6 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: Move over: Manos, the Hands of Fate and From Justin to Kelly
reviews.content: You want to like this film. You really do. You want to ignore the critics and judge for yourself.But in this case, you'll probably be in the majority of everyone here and think this film was not worth the money it took to make. It's all been said, I haven't much to add, just head the warnings.It was an unearned paycheck for a few very talented actors.And they should be ashamed of themselves. All of them.Hey -- but never fret, for this summer, if your movie bombs, you can run for Governor of California.And then you can say,  Ben and J'Lo would make a nice couple like Ronnie and Nancy.A total waste.

Not that bad a film.  Not a masterpiece but very underrated.  Had everyone on the bandwagon of bad buzz actually seen the film, there would be some decent word of mouth.  This should do better on video.Larry Gigli, a "contractor" is hired to kidnap the D.A.'s retarded brother.  Gigli's pretty much a screw up himself, so another contractor, "Ricki" is hired to watch him.  She's fairly new to the game herself.  She's also a lesbian.  This fact doesn't stop Gigli from falling for her, seems like it encourages it.  Of course, comparison's to "Chasing Amy" are inevitable, but just as worthy as comparing "Kill Bill" with "Hard to Kill."   Watch the movie and you'll probably leave thinking what's the big deal.  It wasn't that bad.

I read a lot of the other reviews which I could sympathize with, I see their point. But what shocked me is that the imdb rating of this film is 2.5! Yes, there were many flaws to the film. The terrible acting of Ben Afflecks role and how the script put him all over the place. He was supposed to be a hardened thug, but failed bringing that to the screen miserably. Then what, a softened man under it all? How about we just say he's an average loser who is constantly trying to defend his masculinity, but apparently has none. The Lesbian hopping the fence for this guy? Really? I'm not sure what is more appalling, that someone really thinks a true lesbian would easily swap genders so easily or that Ben afflicts character was soooo enticing that he could win over any gender? And the portrayal of a handicap kid. Wow. I know this is where they were trying to pull the heart strings, but I don't think it would have went over that smoothly from taking someone with such a disability out of their comfort zone and routine...There were some things about the movie that was appealing. I liked the dynamic that Jennifer Lopez portrayed with Ben Affleck. Her role was very masculine when it came to power dynamics. She was never equal with any man, but always above them. She didn't fear them, didn't need to be rescued, she held her ground and acted as though she was above them. It's rare to see those power dynamics in romance comedy, not only was she equal, with Affleck, but she was above him. Jennifer did a good job with her role. She was sexy, powerful, and very well spoken with witty lines. But with that said some might find that annoying, She always came across as putting Affleck down, instead of meeting him in the middle. One fatal flaw even with the power dynamics in reverse, Jennifer never came across as a violent person. She was playing the role of a hired thug, but not for one moment did I believe she would harm a soul.

This movie misfired -- sure -- but it's not nearly as bad as the herd has claimed it to be. People need to see more movies. There is little more annoying than the voice of the uninformed. I was actually looking forward to seeing a really *bad* movie with Gigli but it was much better than the hype suggested. You can explain its #1 position by two words: positive feedback.

I stopped it at the hour and 24 minute mark. This movie is extremely problematic for many ways and the whole concept is problematic. JLo's character is a lesbian and the whole movie Gigli is complaining and harassing her to hook up with him and after turning him down multiple times, Ricki finally gives in? Lmao, this movie would get ripped apart if it premiered in 2021. I'm sad JLo was even part of this trainwreck. I expected action of sorts and there was literally zero action besides the running through a house into a bedroom every so often. Really regret using my scene points to rent this movie. Bad portrayal of special needs people and bad portrayal of lesbians. What a waste of time.

A Hollywood rumor that refuses to die is that Martin Brest's previous effort, "Meet Joe Black", (which was 5 years ago--that should tell you something)was not only a horrible picture but one that was INTENTIONALLY made badly in a "Producers"-style effort by Universal to take a loss on it which, in the byzantine world of Hollywood accounting practices, would actually make money for U in the long run. The specific ins and outs of the accounting maze are too complex to go into, but to guarantee a money-loser, the studio selected the most idiotic script available, threw huge sums of money to Hopkins and Pitt, (both known for phoning in their performances once the check clears), and turning the while mess over to Brest who needed no help in throwing kerosene on this blazing pile. And if you doubt the truth of this, I suggest you rent the DVD just to watch the hospital scene where Pitt speaks in a Jamaican patois while consoling an old lady who is near-death. Or the scene in which Hopkins muses over his late wife's way with a cold lamb sandwich. (Legend has it that several takes were required due to Hopkins' tendency to doze off during this speech.)There are at least another dozen eye-rolling scenes for the masochist.In other words, "Gigli" never stood a chance...

reviews.review_title: A witless, artless, pathetically clumsy affair
reviews.content: This movie falls flat because it does not exist in any context resembling reality, what with its thoroughly convoluted plot and its ridiculously-conceived characters. Sitting through it was like being shipwrecked on a desert island with nothing to eat but expired tins of Spam.To be fair, Jennifer Lopez' speech about the superiority of her private parts (versus the male "sea slug" and/or "big toe" or whatever she calls it), delivered while she writhes face-up on the floor performing some sort of yoga tactic, was nearly watchable. And the guy who plays the mentally challenged dude steals every scene he's in. These are just minor points, though. We're also forced to sit through mind-bogglingly heavy-handed scenes, such as the one where J-Lo's psycho lesbian ex-lover shows up out of the blue and slits her wrists in a fit of deranged hysteria, and the one where Al Pacino (whose idea of acting these days seems to involve yelling his lines louder and louder to convey depth) shows up to rant and rave incoherently until J-Lo's equally meaningless soliloquy renders him - believe it or not - slack-jawed and speechless. By the end of the movie, I felt the same way.

It's not very often I see such horrendous films but this one really bites the bullet. This is an absolute wreck. I couldn't believe that Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck could make such a clunker but I guess after seeing this, anything's possible. The acting was atrocious in this one (and they aren't bad actors), the story was stupid and the dialogue forgettable and laughable. As the film progressed, I was bordering on nausea and sleep (sometimes both, go figure). I mean, what happened here? And Martin Brest the director has made MUCH better films than this - I love Beverly Hills Cop! I guess we all have our hits and misses and in this cast, the cast/director missed big time. But I'm sure this is an anomaly in their careers and I do look forward to their future films.

This was positively the worst, least enjoyable film I've ever seen, and I've seen Ed Wood movies.  The acting was horrible, the dialogue was insipid, the pacing CRAWLED.  You couldn't even believe that Jennifer Lopez was falling for Ben Affleck.  On the plus side, the lighting was good.   Of course, when it's illuminating action this bad, that, too, is a deficit.

reviews.review_title: One of the very worst movies I've ever seen
reviews.content: GIGLI, or was it TOUGH LOVE, or GIGLY? Really...This is such a bad movie and I really don't want to write a serius reviwe about it, because it made me so tired, gasping for anything else than more of Ben Affleck and Jennifer Lopez. It's truly a terribly bad movie! It starts of with a horrifyingly bad scene with Affleck being a hit-man, and the movie just gets worse from there. The first entrance of Lopez is gruesome. But the worst scene is when Lopez starts chatting on about her lesbian sh**...And Christopher Walken and Al Pacino enters in small roles, it just shows so clearly off that the old, method men do everything for the money these days! Though I've never really liked Affleck this just made me sort of hate him, and what's with the story?? GIGLI wants to be funny but in the same time smart, it wants to be cool and stylish, but it misses every single point! It never hits it targets, it keeps missing so much! STARS: 1/5

reviews.review_title: Bad Things Happen to Good Movies
reviews.content: Like many others, I'm confounded by all of the overwhelmingly negative reviews this movie is getting.  I don't think I've ever witnessed the assassination of a movie before, and this proves that the professional critics really do have power.  Maybe I had the advantage of having no expectations whatsoever, but I thoroughly enjoyed watching this film.It's not a cinematic triumph, nobody's going to get an Oscar, though Al Pacino (as always) probably deserves one for chewing up the scenery.  I think people had two fundamental problems with the movie:  it wasn't an action movie (and everyone's on an action sugar-high after a dozen or so summer action films) and the female lead was a lesbian.  If this movie had been released in the fall or spring, and not hyped as a summer B.Af-J.Lo blockbuster, it probably would have been more favourably received.The movie has interesting--often clever--dialogue, an interesting turn-around in sexual dominance and an unexpected ending that put a smile on my face.  No cars were smashed, the death-count only reached one and the characters just sat around and talked.  So what?  For the most part what they talked about was intriguing.It's a shame, but bad things sometimes happen to perfectly good movies. Rent it when it comes out on video.

reviews.review_title: Much better than people give it credit for1
reviews.content: I decided to watch this movie on TV to see why it was so ridiculed. I honestly don't understand why so many people rate this movie so poorly. I found it surprisingly charming and often quite funny, certainly better than most romantic comedies one sees these days. Affleck's clueless hood is a stitch, Lopez is terrific (loved her sensuous yoga scene!), and the Bryan character is played to perfection. Perhaps the plot doesn't make perfect sense, but many decent movies require the suspension of disbelief. I think the bad reviews are probably more of a negative reaction to the "Bennifer" relationship than to this movie. Even Roger Ebert gives it two and a half stars!

I've been resisting the urge to watch Gigli for years. Yet after Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck rekindled their romance and the movie was included in my streaming service, I gave in.With the current iMDb score you'd expect a stelar level of incompetence, but Gigli turned out to be far from that. In fact, it proved how irrelevant iMDb score is.I agree the script is clumsy and overtly verbose. Yet back in the day there were other authors who offered the same with far less substance and received standing ovations. For example, Quentin Tarantino.The cast was solid. I mean, is anyone asserting there is even a statistical probability that Christopher Walken or Al Pacino may deliver a bad performance? This, in fact, makes Lainie Kazan and Missy Crider shine even brighter because I didn't expect anything from them.From what we've seen so far, Justin Bartha delivered a role of his life in Gigli. And there is an obvious chemistry between Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck.Gigli is a romantic comedy with elements of a crime thriller. Despite the questionable script, it has heartwarming moments, funny jokes and some suspense.Will I watch Gigli again? No. Will I recommend it? Probably not. But I've seen far worse movies that fared better at iMDb.

Synopsis Spoiler! What was Hollywood thinking when they put these two stars together for a movie like this?  Do not go to this `stinkaroo'. People left the theater last night and I should have been one of them.  I really don't see why I should tell you the plot line, but I will, since I saw the whole movie.  Larry Gigli (Ben Affleck) is a small-time hood in Los Angeles, who gets a mob assignment to kidnap Brian (Justin Bartha), the psychologically challenged younger brother of a federal prosecutor who is trying to send a New York mob boss, Starkman (Al Pacino) to prison.  Gigli's boss, Louis (Lenny Venito) doesn't trust Gigli with this important job, so he sends in reinforcements in the form of a beautiful lesbian assassin, Ricki (Jennifer Lopez).  Gigli tries to win the affections of Ricki until he finds out that she is a lesbian. The movie goes downhill from there, especially, with all the vulgar language.  The only good scene in the movie was when Starkman flies to LA to take care of business with some payback.  Too bad he didn't also take care of the writers.  0/10
I just rate it as 10 because it does not deserve such a low overall score.

Hey NotBradley! Like my summary says: SHUT UP!! Who gives a damn if someone gave thumbs up to a bad movie? I know I don't! If you truly hated this movie why would you give a damn what someone else thinks? Usually when I hate a movie, I try and forget it. And I certainly don't comment on a section of a site (that's meant to state an opinion about  the FILM!), about how someone likes it and then bash them for it. However, I do realize I'm doin' the same here, but someone needs to straighten you out! So quit puttin' people down for their ratings of films! They're are entitled to it!

reviews.review_title: I'm speechless. this movie is possibly the best of 2003.
reviews.content: I can't believe everyone hated this movie.  I watched Gigli thinking it was going to be the worst movie ever made, but I was very wrong.  I will think twice before labeling a movie based on a critic's reviews.  Gigli combines humor with a perfect mobster atmosphere.  The plot-line left a little to be desired, but it could have been worse.  I know people will attack me for my comments, but I don't care.  Although, if my comments are to be criticized, I hope it is by one of the other ten people that have seen the movie.

Why god, why?! Why have thou forsaken us? Did any one stop and think during filming, that this was a big pile of smelly cheese? I guess not. I think any one who was involved with the production of this trash, should have to pay all the money they made to Charity. Maybe Godzilla 2000 was slightly worst...just maybe. Is it just me, or is "J-Lo" in to her 17th minute of fame right now? Good lord, I can't wait till her 15 minutes are up so I can see the back of her. (no pun intended) Same gose for Ben (I can't act) too. Ron Jerrey is a better actor then olé Ben. They should bring back MST3K, just to burn this movie. I think the robots would do it Justice.

reviews.review_title: This is a good movie, despite what others say.
reviews.content: I think most of the people who hate this movie hate it simply because it stars Ben Affleck. Why people have an unnatural hate for Affleck, I'll never know. Personally, I like the guy.A lot of people will slam this movie because they think it doesn't make since. Like "If Jennifer Lopez is a lesbian, then why does she sleep with Ben Affleck?" or "Why is there a scene where she simply discusses the pros and cons of vaginas and penises". A lot of people will think these scenes or plot points to be pointless, when in fact, without them, the movie would be kinda bad. These two examples (which I've heard more than one person bitch about), are very important.The vagina discussion helps to build Jennifer Lopez's character, as well as help develop Ben Affleck's character. Sure, it's not in your face character development, you just have to watch closely.Shortly before Lopez and Affleck have sex, what happens? First, Ben Affleck and Jennifer Lopez form a bit a bond, followed by (in a very Chasing Amy like moment) Affleck admitting he likes her. Now, the way I saw it anyway, is that the bond they'd formed (though a bit of a bumpy bond) made Jennifer Lopez see him in a different light as opposed to all of the men she knew. And, keep in mind faithful readers, she had been with men in the past (i.e. Gigli's mom saying to her "You've been with men before though.." or something close to that). Now, right before they have sex, what does she ask Affleck to do? She asks him to check his nails. He does, and he does it in a feminine way (sadly, I also checked my nails in a feminine way). Now, her bond with him, along with his feminine traits, made her more willing to give him a throw. I hope the sex scene makes more sense now.Ultimately, you'll have to decide whether you like this movie or not. I can't make that decision for you. But all I ask is that you watch the movie closely (don't take phone calls, leave the room or talk during the movie). Believe it or not, some movies you do need to pay attention to (which really, you should be paying attention anyway).Remember this bit: Pacino is in this movie. Pacino has a habit of making good movies. Also: Roger Ebert liked this movie. He has a habit of liking good movies.If you give the film a chance and still hate it, well, not every movie is for every person, but try not to go into this movie with any biases or set opinions of how you think it'll be.

reviews.review_title: Haha The most overhyped and overwhelming worst crap ever made so far
reviews.content: I have to say I was not surprised about just how god awful Gigli was, its beyond awful, its shi$, its an abomination. Of course all the ass kissing junkets in Hollywood: Access Hollywood, Extra, you name it, were overhypering the film and I thank God it stunk.Jennifer , Lord of the Rings, Lopez, is the most bratty actress Ive seen in quite awhile and Ive seen em all. A friend downloaded the film for me and thank God, no one unless your a big freaking idiot should see the movie Gigli.

reviews.review_title: ... and then when Affleck mooed like a cow, I threw my hands up in the air and said, "Yagggghhhh!"
reviews.content:
I can't say that this movie is the worst I've ever seen because there was actually one scene in the movie that made me laugh. If it was a total bomb, I wouldn't have laughed once. It was where Lopez's ex-girlfriend forces herself into Gigli's apartment and threatens him with a kick to the skull that would cave it in, to which J. Lo responds with a sincere, yes, she really can do all that stuff. I don't know if that made any sense to you but I actually found it hilarious. The rest of the movie however, is absolutely horrible. It's not even funny bad, it's just sad bad. The best way I can sum up this movie is like this: imagine someone telling you a joke that goes on and on and on, with none of the details leading up to the punchline being funny (well, in this particular joke, it'd be that one moment I mentioned above), all just for there to be no punchline whatsoever. If you can imagine how frustrating that is or if you've already experienced something similar, then you know what watching Gigli is like.
Watching it (which was purely out of morbid curiosity, I assure you), I couldn't figure out exactly what kind of movie I was watching. Was it a violent mob movie? Was it a comedy? Was it a love story? Was it an unsuccessful mix of all three? I don't know what the hell it was, honestly. The movie has these tender, cringe inducing moments that is cued to syrupy music, enough to make you gag with nausea. But then you'll get a scene where someone literally comes out of nowhere and slashes their wrists with a carving knife. Throw in a rap-slinging retarded kid with whom the main characters get inexplicably attached to and you have... well, what exactly?
This movie is just... there's just too much to trash here. I haven't even mentioned the cameos by Christopher Walken and Al Pacino. Anybody remember the last time Walken wasn't able to steal his scenes in whatever movie he did? Here's the movie for you. As for Al Pacino, I think he agreed to do this movie only because he would get to overact in it. His performance is absolutely horrible. I want the return of the quiet, brooding Pacino instead of this yelling maniac who thinks he's turning in something of artistic value. I'd like to see him do something these days where I don't need to be reminded that the person playing the part is indeed Al Pacino. Ben Affleck is never quite convincing as a tough guy and I'm sorry to say it but he comes off as a big softee. I have to give him credit for playing a punk who actually moos to his newfound lady in order to specify what his position is in their new relationship. Jennifer Lopez looks damn good but even her foxy self can't save this from flying into the mountains. Her character left me wondering exactly why she was put into the movie in the first place.This movie sucks and while I think it was viewed mainly as ammo against the real life Ben and Jen union (at the time of this writing, they have officially broken up), I think it should be viewed for what it is: a really bad movie. I think we need to leave those two alone for awhile.RATING: 0* out of *****.

reviews.review_title: For once,a film as bad as the critics say it is!
reviews.content: Professional film critics really do get it wrong sometimes,especially when they unfairly criticise films that are just meant to entertain,and nothing else. But with Gigli,they got it right. This is a truly embarrassing picture with a script so atrocious that I can't understand how it was decided "Ooo this'll make a good film.lets make it!".Supposedly this is a comedy,but the only laughs come from how bad it is. The basic setup-a hit-man kidnaps a mentally disabled boy and falls for a lesbian hitwoman sent to help him,is not quite the worst ever,but still a pathetic excuse for a movie. The central Ben and Jen relationship is woefully unconvincing and lacking in chemistry. One lengthy scene inwhich they discuss the merits of straight versus lesbian relationships had to be one of worst dialogue scenes ever written,climaxing in Lopez giving in to him {of course it only takes someone like Affleck and,hey,she's going to become straight}and saying "gobble gobble,it's turkey time". The mentally disabled boy just exists to be laughed at-films do not have to be politically correct but it's pathetic how almost all of the film's supposed intentional laughs are aimed at him. Every now and again a 'dramatic' bit is thrown in-a shooting,a wrist-slitting,and Christopher Walken and Al Pacino both turn up for a scene each,spout some muddled lines for about five minutes,and leave. unfortunately the gangster element never really feels like a part of the film,mind you,nothing hangs together,including a Baywatch subplot which becomes excruciating ten minutes in and gives the film it's 'climax'.Almost every dialogue scene takes three times longer than it need to be to get the relevant information across,an irritating fault that virtually destroyed Martin Brest's previous film Meet Joe Black,and yet here some scenes that would make the plot clearer actually seem to be missing. The phtotgraphy is ugly,the music score pathetic,and Affleck gives his worst performance yet {yes,it's that ba}],pulling odd facial expressions rather than actually acting. Lopez is not too bad,but she has always been a reasonably good actress,check out Out Of Sight and Enough.This is a disaster on every level,but it also has to be seen to be believed.

I was captivated and eventually rewarded by watching GigliIts obvious the lets-jump-on-the-bandwagon effect kicked in and Ben and JLo have always been one of those love-to-hate celebraties!But looking beyond this I found an interesting film Yes, its slow, very slow moving to start with and the plot is ethereal but I'm a huge fan of Easy Rider, Waking Life and other films without an obvious plot so I found Gigli captivating from the startBy the end of the film I was glad to see they had avoided stupid car chases and fight scenes which would have got in the way of the flowUltimately this is a love story and all other aspects of the story are secondary, sure characters come and go but that doesn't matter, its not the pointThe commentry on male ego and the nature of our society is enlightening and thought provoking. Its an uplifting film at heartIts also obviously an adventureous movie and it shows, some of the interaction scenes are comical, sometimes there are way too many words used and you start smiling. Reading from a Tabasco sauce bottle was too much! Was this intentional? I'm not sure but I found it funny and you don't often get that with stream of consciousness type movies I don't know how to describe it but there is an aura about Gigli that I ended up enjoying Being an optimist I put down any faults simply to naivity, and this is not necessarily always a bad thingIt reminded me of Buffalo 66 In this film a convict kidnaps a girl and they end up falling in loveWhat can I say? This film worked for me!

Ben and J.lo's offscreen romance PENETRATES the screen and truly carries onto the big screen, making the film quite enjoyable! The "f" word is used nonstop in this movie, and that's what makes Gigli so cool! everyone likes vulgarity! J.lo shines as the lesbian who suddenly turns straight and DIGS ben! If i had the option to see this movie again, WHERE DO I SIGN UP, because i'd sooo see it once more!9/10

reviews.review_title: I'm sorry,but the movie just makes no sense
reviews.content: POSSIBLE SPOILERS:Although everybody was giving it a low grade probably because of the presence of J-lo and Ben-lo,I have to say this: Besides that it just is a terrible movie,it just is!The scenes are too long,the acting is awful,even by acclaimed master actors like Christopher Walken and Al Pacino(what are they doing here?). Ben Affleck,who wanted to become a serious actor has totally lost it becoming an add-on to J-Lo.Oh the humanity of it all,she really can't act.Sure she can show her az and that's probably why Martin Brest focuses a lot on her body and not on her face.WAAHAA,she plays a lesbian in the movie,talking'about unbelievable characterization.The rest of the characters and the rest of the story is totally unreal and at best... well it just don't go anywhere!Better to forget it quickly and oh yes: I SURVIVED GIGLI! 1/10

This movie deserved all the slams that it got.  Repulsive, meandering, pointless.  The only pleasant surprise in this mess was that it was evidently not JLo's fault, which is what I was at least led to believe.  She is fine, it is that boyfriend of hers who is rotten.  Unbelievable that that talented Martin Brest both wrote and directed this.  Really unbelievable. It is not the kind of bad movie you could get a kick out of watching, like Plan 9.  The scene with the fish tank is disgusting and out of left field. This could be the worst movie ever made.

1. Not only that suicidal people don't do it in a way that is shown in the movie, but also it looks like she just wanted attention. 
2. Basic ignorance of the lesbianism. 
3. Very poor character development, and I say it as a psychologist.I accidentally watched it on the TV, what a waste of time. I'm so disappointed.

A wanna be thug named Gigli (rhymes with "really") is assigned by his slimy boss to kidnap a mentally retarded cousin of a Federal Prosecuter. Jennifer Lopez's character Rikki is assigned to make sure that Gigli doesn't screw up the job. Gigli is stunned by Rikki though, and is tortured by the fact that he can't have Rikki in a relationship. Because she is a lesbian.Call me insane, but the movie wasn't as bad as I thought it would be. The only reason I say this is because it has a couple scenes of dialogue that are interesting. Like when Gigli is explaining how he is crushed that he can't have Rikki, When Rikki and Gigli discuss the statistics of pleasure, the scenes of how people check their nails. It was also interesting to see Pacino in action about his great, "thumb/ digit" dialogue build up to his discovery of Gigli's failure to trick him.If "Gigli" was released as a lower budget, straight to Video film then I think that it wouldn't be as hated as it is. But make no mistake, it is still an embarassing disaster. but if you have nothing better to do, wipe the dust off of this one in the video store in a couple years, and give it a try. it's bad, but still watchable. */****

reviews.review_title: I watched it entirely so you don't have to
reviews.content:
In a perverse desire to watch some of the worst cringy movies ever made, this one was above all expectations. It asked stamina, self discipline and a pretty high dose of masochism to keep this one running until the end. The story has been described as being syrupy enough to kill anyone who suffers from diabetes (or doesn't), and it can't be contested. The whole plot is completely absurd, paced by ben affleck's love feelings, a lesbian j lopez yoga's moves and thumbs cut with plastic knives. Absolutely everything sucks about this movie. The storyline, the dialogues, the acting, there's absolutely nothing to save from it.
However, if in a sadistic goal you enjoy watching lame movies and hate on them, you definitely should focus on this one. It deserves all the insults you can muster but be warned, it will suck the life out of you for 2 hours

reviews.review_title: Not as bad, but bad (some spoilers)
reviews.content: (SOME SPOILERS) When Gigli was released the summer of 2003, everyone panned the film. Thanks to the worldwide panning, it flopped at the box office. I saw the film for myself, and to tell you the truth, it wasn't that bad. But it was bad. It's hard to understand. Let me break it down for you. The way Gigli was received, you would think it's...hmm....Jason X bad. It's not that bad but it just isn't a good film.First off, Ben Affleck's Italian or Brooklyn accent is bad. Jennifer Lopez's 20 minute speech (just exaggerating) about the vagina, was also bad. And to top it off, the annoying mentally retarded guy rapping to Baby's Got Back was the all time worst. This film was just a total let down to the Bennifer fans out there (not including me).The film just didn't work for me. There are a lot of films that I'd say are worst. But nonetheless, Gigli could be on the list for one of the worst films.Gigli- Rated R *1/2 out of ****

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as I thought , but I can see why many critics hated it.
reviews.content: This movie has the hopes of being a good film, if it wasn't for a very poorly written script (and J.Lo is in it too; I liked her when she was just Jennifer Lopez).Anyway, the main plot of the story is a good one. It is all the extra crap that they throw into it that makes it a very boring and sucky film to enjoy. There is lots of pointless dialogue that has nothing to do with anything. Most of it comes from J. Lo's mouth, so I guess they gave the dialogue to the right person. It's a shame the Christopher Walkin got to spew out some of that terrible dialogue as well. I'm a big fan of his, but I have to say that his role in this movie served no real purpose at all.Ben Affleck is a good actor and I am a fan of many of his films. I just don't think that he is a very good character actor. His New Yorker accent (or whatever the hell he's supposed to be) seems forced. He had some pretty decent lines in the film though.Al Pacino was the man. His role was the best one in this film. At least his role served a real purpose. SPOILER!!!I found myself glad when he shot Gigli's boss. I'm surprised nobody else had shot that character earlier in the film. He was completely obnoxious and the actor who played the character sucked at playing it.So there you have it. That's what I think of the movie. Martin Breast is a lousey screenwriter, but then again I couldn't do any better. I guess there's hope for me if I ever decide to write a screenplay.

Now I see why this movie is one of those bottom rated movies. But I really can't believe it's one of Martin Brest's works. How come? Did he just get hit by a car or something? Please.... Did you just forget that I really love you Scent Of A Woman movie??? I know you didn't write that movie, but still...There's too much unnecessary dialogues and screens in this movie. It's a comedy, crime and romance. but somehow I couldn't really feel them from the dialogues. They're so lame. Sometimes I feel silence while I was watching this movie.I think Martin is trying to make a movie like Pulp Fiction, which genre is crime and comedy. But come on, it's so far from heaven. I enjoyed Pulp Fiction a lot. But okay, I appreciate Justin Bartha's performance. I think he's the only one who is captivating in this movie. And Al Pacino, too, actually. To me, he's still amazing here.

The movie wasn't as bad as everyone made it out to be.  The problem is it came out at the height of the B.Lo Backlash, and a LOT of people jumped on the bandwagon.  Granted, Affleck's acting skills are not what they used to be (he is Ben Affleck playing Ben Affleck playing a character) but he wasn't bad enough to deserve the flack he got for the damn movie.  I found the film somewhat emotional due to the cruelty Larry Gigli puts the poor disabled kid through (I have two kids of my own, and to even imagine talking to them like he does to the kid in this movie is heartbreaking) and the ending where the kid finally gets to see "the Baywatch" made me somewhat misty-eyed.  I am not a fan of Lopez (she DOES however look spectacular in this flick), nor am I fan of Affleck, but the flick deserves better.

reviews.review_title: This movie is a lot better than advertised...
reviews.content: I cannot believe that the critics slammed this movie as being one of the worst movies ever.  I thought there many funny moments in this movie and Jennifer Lopez was very good.  Al Pacino was great in his cameo.  I have seen many worse movies this year.  The ending was pretty lame and left many unanswered questions but I like this movie.

Gigli is slowly climbing away from the bottom of the bottom 100, currently about 7th worst. I think that's still unfair. I think the main problem of this film is that it's dull, none of the characters are really worthy of interest. You don't believe that Gigli is a thug, that J-Lo is a lesbian thug or that the "retard" is real. The cameos from Walken & Pacino are catastrophic. As I write this Bonnie & Clyde come to mind but without the glamour and excitement. You can see this film tried really hard to be worthy, the desperate attempt of losers to find happiness. There are hundred's of worse films out there!! You could watch it all the way through.

This is the biggest exploitation of power by movie stars i have ever seen. Its nothing but an excuse to work with your significant other and it just ends up been a heap of garbage. And it contains the already famous line, its turkey time, GOBBLE GOBBLE..or something. It fuels the fire of current movie goers who are sick of bad movies. Maybe they should charge ppl less for bad movies in the first place so they don't risk infuriating everyone. Like charge 2 bucks for a bad movie and regular price for a good movie. I mean i am sure they are losing money because if i had a bad experience at the theatres, i am less likely to return for another movie no matter what the next movie is. I guess what i am just trying to say is that Gigli leaves a bad tastes in your mouth...Turkey stink...GOBBLE GOBBLE!!0/10

I MUST admit: I didn't see Gigli in the theaters because I WAS tired of hearing about "Bennifer" all the time. However, I purchased it on DVD (I'm a die-hard Affleck fan) to make up my own mind about it. I don't see what the big deal is? Its certainly not the best flick ever (no Chasing Amy) but it isn't the worst either. Sure, the writing seems half-assed but I didn't think that Jen and Ben performed poorly. I DO think that the "Gobble, gobble" line was the absolute worst line in the history of movies and I laughed but not because it was funny; I laughed because someone thought that that line WOULD have been funny and unfortunately, it was just tragic. Nevertheless, I tell anyone who will listen that I have seen the movie and even OWN the DVD and (after they stop giggling), I offer it up for them to watch so that they can come to their own conclusion, which I'm guessing many people have NOT done. Since then, I don't know of anyone who has passed out from boredom or died from it being a crappy flick. Most people admit that, again, it wasn't the worst movie they'd ever seen (Hello? Ishtar?) so give it a chance! My guess is that its going to be a 'cult classic' someday....

reviews.review_title: Justin and Kelly, you've got competition!
reviews.content: How long does Hollywood think we will stand this garbage? A friend took me to see it, and by the end of the film I was demanding compensation for my time. This film is no doubt going to prove to be far scarier than seeing the upcoming Freddy vs. Jason movie!

I like Ben Affleck. He's a talented person and I'm sure he's a nice guy, but clearly he wasn't thinking straight when he decided to sign on to this mess. Not even him, Christopher Walken, or Al Pacino could save this movie from failing.At one point, Ben Affleck and Jennifer Lopez as a couple was a big thing for tabloids & the media but here, they have zero chemistry in this movie, which isn't good for a romantic comedy. It's barely acted and it feels as if there wasn't even a script during production. The film revolves around Affleck as a gangster who has to kidnap a mentally challenged man (played by Justin Bartha), then J-Lo helps him out and the catch is that she's a lesbian. Imagine Kevin Smith's decent movie "Chasing Amy" minus the enjoyment, while adding a crime plot and pretentiousness and you have "Gigli".Apparently, this flop of a movie costs around $75.5 million dollars. Where did all the money go? How can anyone green-light this? I went into the movie with an open mind and five minutes into it, I knew it was only going to get worse and worse. I take full responsibility for seeing it out of my own curiosity, so you don't have to sit through this painful 2 hour garbage. If you like Ben Affleck, go watch "Good Will Hunting" instead of "Gigli" and you'll thank me later!

Public backlash to this film was immediate, intense and in my thinking, irrational. The public was so sick of hearing about the Affleck/Lopez relationship by release time(justifiably so) that as soon as the bad reviews started to pour in from critical sources, most people were quick to call in the worst film ever before even seeing it.The rub here is that "Gigli" isn't the worst film ever -- it's merely really bad. A really bad movie isn't inept enough to be unintentionally hilarious for the ironic viewer. It takes a truly horrible movie to become a great comedy, while Gigli is just bad enough to be boring without becoming funny. As a result I was disappointed, as I'm sure many others who expecting this to be an unintentional comedy masterpiece were.Most disappointing - and unfair, in my opinion - were the performances of Affleck and Lopez, which were wooden and dull but certainly not the complete train wreck I was led to expect. Also, to blame them for making this awful movie is just asinine on the part of the viewing public. The pair of leads are *not* the reason "Gigli" sucks. It sucks for the reasons every other bad movie sucks: bad writing and awful direction. The screenplay is a forced, hackneyed attempt at emulating the hip crime films of the '90s(of the "Pulp Fiction" variety). The direction and editing is even worse; just about every scene is unmemorable, drab, uninspired, and proceeds at an excruciatingly slow pace. Martin Brest is both director and screenwriter, and he is the one who should have been lambasted endlessly by critics. No love for Affleck/Lopez from me, but let's at least give credit where it is due.

After watching this movie, I was left wondering if the critics have actually seen it before commenting on it. The movie was significantly better than expected, considering all the bad reviews it got. The dialogue is engaging and the movie is very funny. The chemistry between Jen and Ben is great. The story is not necessarily realistic, but this is not the point of this movie... It is more of a romantic comedy rather than an action flick. I was entertained for the entire duration of the movie. I recommend for anyone who wants to comment on this movie to go and see it first.

reviews.review_title: Stay away from this double vanity flick!
reviews.content: "Gigli" is a foul-mouthed, lifeless double vanity piece. A contender for the list of the ten worst films of 2003.ACTING = Be sure to miss the one scene each of overacting cameos by Al Pacino, Christopher Walken, and Lainie Kazan; otherwise, no comment.DIRECTING = out to lunchPHOTOGRAPHY = when in doubt, do another extreme close-upPLOT = aimlessSCRIPT = If you remove the "f" words, you could save a half-hour from the two hour bloat.Strictly for Ben & J-Lo fans.GRADE = "D"

Alright,  First off you may notice that I have rated this movie a ten. However, I truly feel this movie to be closer to a 6 rating.  My reason for the 10 rating was to make up for the very low and unworthy ratings which have been posted.  Alright... now to the REAL review.The first disappointing aspect of the film was its very poor casting. Sure Christopher Walken and Al Pacino excellent thesbians, but being like Louis (Lenny Ventino) seem to have no place in the film, especially as an intimidating (maybe sleazy) gangster.  Aside from that is the obvious, Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck as contract 'thugs', er... very ...bizarre.
On to the films high points.  'Jen and Ben' carry together an undeniable form of chemistry, and watching the two of them (no matter how sick we are of hearing about their beautiful relationship) brings a good feeling to everyone.  The film has many humorous aspects, and Justin Bartha plays the lovable, mentally-challenged Brian.In summation, this film is not oscar worthy and won't keep the water cooler busy with philosophical banter, but it is enjoyable and makes us smile...isn't that what movies were intended to be.

reviews.review_title: Not the best, but definitely not the worst
reviews.content: Well, okay, I admit, after hearing all the reviews, I have to say I wasn't expecting much... but the 4 of us who went all agreed that it definitely wasn't nearly as bad as the critics have been saying.  I wouldn't call it a great classic by any means, but I've definitely seen a lot worse.  The pace could've been sped up in places, but there were some really good lines, a few funny and sweet scenes, and all in all... it was okay.

reviews.review_title: Don't listen to the negative comments
reviews.content: Well , I expected to see one of the worst movies ever as its reputation indicates. I was surprised that the movie is just amazing and funny with a really great acting from Ben and J Lo , so I loved it. I didn't understand why it received such negative critics , then I started to understand the reason. The reason is yhat many stupid people found the film offensive to the gays and lesbians. Not because it's boring, not because it's ridiculous. Only because it can be offensive to the LGBT community. That's a very ridiculous , absurd and stupid reason to hate a movie. So grow the hell up and watch the movie with an open mind. Just enjoy it.

Bad?  Gigli?  It wasn't so bad!  Okay, so it wasn't so good -- but it certainly wasn't all that bad!   Not really.  After all, didn't it have Ben and Jen, not to mention Chris and Al?  How can those guys be in a bad movie?  I ask you, how? Come to think of it, they're all real good, and theyre not only real good, they're dang good!  Now come to think of it I rely think this movie is just fine!  Not just fine, but good.  Dang Good!  Okay, it maybe was  just a little long and boring.  So what? It was directed by that guy what directed Smell of a Women, wasn't it ? That shure wasn't bad, now how can this be bad?  I ask you?  How?  Come to think of it, the movie was just fine, not just fine -- good!  Real good!  It cost alot, didnt it? It was better than fine -- it was grate!  One of the best Iv seen, I think. Not bad at all!  The best of the summer  in fact!  Even maybe the best movee Iv ever seen, ever ever !!   Ever!  Dang!! it wuz good -- reall good, I loved it, personaly.  It was grate!! Super!!  I meaan  it was the BEST!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!(Just kidding.)

reviews.review_title: Being seen walking out of Gigli - next great fad!
reviews.content: This is America's newest cult movie.  It was out of our idol-worship culture this beast was conceived. Why else would this movie and "From Justin to Kelly" be the worst two rated movies on this site?  Even worse than Manos, the Hands of Fate.  10 years ago this movie would go straight to video.  10 years before that this movie would never been made.Have you noticed? Openly hating this movie is now an "in thing".  People are actually paying money to be seen walking out during the movie.  After the Gobble-gobble scene of coarse, where the entire crowd mocks Lopez doing their own turkey impersonations.  The entire theater sounds like a turkey farm on the day before Thanksgiving!  But she has her fans, who may be calling "Stop the J-Lo boycott!".  They faithfully watch the movie, shake their fists and cry "U-Go girl!" after every J-Lo wit and worse of all boo and hiss anyone who gets to their feet heading for the exit.  The truth is, the movie was doomed with extremely poor writing and directing.  Was it a comedy, romance, drama, action?  No, it was an ego feeding frenzy.  Our money, the main course.  Ask yourself: if J-Lo was offered 100% of the ticket sales, would she be grateful or insulted?  C'mon you know the answer!  And that too is why critics and the general population showed J-Lo and company no mercy, and no $$$. (0/10)Lessons I learned: A movie title that is not easily pronounced is not cute. "I am J-Lo.  Love me!" is not a magical incantation to bring box office success. Greedy movie execs are too afraid of J-Lo and would rather lose multiple millions of dollars rather than stand up to her even though their opinions are reinforced by millions of movie goers.

I never liked Ben Affleck even before his disastrous pairing w/Jennifer Lopez, and had actually never given her much thought. However, since everyone was talking like this film should be nuked out of existence I thought I'd go see what the fuss was all about (I sometimes like garbage that the rest of the world despises, see "1941.") Says something about a flick when people are going to see it just to decide if it's as BAD as advertised! It was pretty bad-Affleck is simply useless in any type of leading man role, and I couldn't figure out what purpose a gay JLo served if all she was going to do was tease Gigli. It was bad-really bad, but not quite "Autumn in New York" bad. Jennifer Lopez probably won't suffer quite the same fate as Elizabeth Berkley (see "Showgirls"-oh, no, just kidding!) and may actually work again, but I wish Ben Affleck would just go away, or stick to writing.
